content.subject: Rishi Badlani
content.assertion: Rishi presented his task paralysis problem - wanting to change jobs but struggling to start
content.quoted_text: There's, like, these, these things in my head that I'm always, like, thinking, like, I should do this or I should do that.

content.subject: Rishi Badlani
content.assertion: Rishi shared he's been stuck in finance for a decade wanting to change
content.quoted_text: I've been saying this for maybe a decade, but I always, I've never, I can't, I find it very hard or I just don't do it to, in order to get started

content.subject: Rishi Badlani
content.assertion: Rishi identified sports and social connection as what interests him
content.quoted_text: It's crazy how that works, you know, and I don't know, I just think there's a social aspect to it that, you know, people... People really just are, you know, have a lot in common with it

content.subject: Gio
content.assertion: Gio presented her singing for mental health meetup idea from a year ago
content.quoted_text: singing for mental health and wellness, and here's a description of a session, or the idea, a meetup session, interactive experience designed to help neurodiverse participants

content.subject: Gio
content.assertion: Gio mentioned she has trouble getting started and this idea is a year old
content.quoted_text: first, I have trouble getting started. Like this, this thing I wrote out like a year or so ago, and I haven't started

content.subject: Gregory Cowley
content.assertion: Greg shared he has three jobs - college professor, Exploratorium fabricator, and museum exhibit consultant
content.quoted_text: I have a college professor teaching interaction design, a fabricator at the Exploratorium, and then I work with my own clients on museum exhibits

content.subject: Gregory Cowley
content.assertion: Greg described his vision of a workshop space with collaborations happening
content.quoted_text: I always had the dream of having like a workshop or, you know, a building where people were, you know, workshops were happening in there

content.subject: Gregory Cowley
content.assertion: Greg summarized his takeaway - wanting all of it but in a more manageable package
content.quoted_text: what I really want is all of it, but in a more manageable package

content.subject: Doug Snyder
content.assertion: Doug shared his pattern of overestimating time, overcomplicating, and underestimating effort
content.quoted_text: I will, I will overestimate how long it takes, I will overcomplicate it, I will underestimate. What it will take.

content.subject: Rick Webster
content.assertion: Rick noted Doug made affirmations for things he doesn't want to do
content.quoted_text: you just made affirmations for all the things that you don't want to do. I will take too long. I will do this. I will do that. And your subconscious mind just heard all those things as affirmations.

content.subject: Rishi Badlani
content.assertion: Rishi committed to updating resume and looking at Fanatics job postings
content.quoted_text: The resume that I have, two job postings that I need, which were related to like Fanatics is a company that I was thinking about applying to

content.subject: Gio
content.assertion: Gio committed to imagining the group, what she'd enjoy, and finding friends to invite
content.quoted_text: Imagine what I see the group would look like. Imagine what I would enjoy, having people come along for the ride and then finding people for the ride, like looking at my friend list

content.subject: Gregory Cowley
content.assertion: Greg committed to reducing stress/weight and getting back to exercising
content.quoted_text: definitely trying to reduce the stress or reduce the weight, I guess I should say. And actually, I need to get back on exercising

content.subject: Lizzy Summers
content.assertion: Lizzy committed to telling someone every day she has something for sale
content.quoted_text: I'm going to tell somebody every day until our next meeting I have something for sale

content.subject: Doug Snyder
content.assertion: Doug committed to slowing down and getting workbench ready for his big project
content.quoted_text: slowing down is I have a big project ahead of me. All of a sudden, now all of a sudden, the pressure. So I'm stopping to get my quote-unquote workbench ready

content.subject: Doug Snyder
content.assertion: Doug shared his morning walking habit with phone buddies that stacks multiple benefits
content.quoted_text: I go hike up a local hill that's right outside my house, so I'm lucky that way. But I do some movement and talk with people and wake up and talk about interesting ideas, so I get four things in once

content.subject: Melissa Reskof
content.assertion: Melissa noted Doug did a big lifestyle change after diabetes diagnosis - walks daily and keto diet
content.quoted_text: Doug got a diabetes diagnosis, I would say two or three years ago, and did a big lifestyle change. He walks every day with some buddies on the phone who are Zoom buddies, and he moved over to a keto regime

content.subject: Stara Shakti
content.assertion: Stara announced she's doing Melissa's podcast Sunday - Decolonizing Therapy coaching program
content.quoted_text: Decolonizing Therapy 12-Week Coaching Program, among other things, among other things, among Chuck DeFair Rising
